full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 529 Filed 12/08/21 Page 13 of 18 13 LBF3MAXC

1 MS. COMEY: I do think we anticipate opposing the subpoena, your Honor. In terms of which way mechanically your Honor would like to proceed we don't have a particular preference, but I think we would like to brief that issue.
2
3 THE COURT: Well, I think the only constraint under the rule, the victims have to be notified. So I'd like that notification to happen today.
4
5 MS. COMEY: Yes, your Honor.
6
7 THE COURT: And then I suppose, why don't you propose when the government would brief any opposition.
8
9 MS. COMEY: May I have a moment, your Honor?
10
11 THE COURT: You may.
12
13 MS. COMEY: We would propose by Thursday of this week, your Honor.
14
15 THE COURT: So if we do Wednesday of this week and response from the defense by Friday.
16
17 MS. COMEY: Thank you, your Honor.
18
19 MR. PAGLIUCA: Your Honor, on that point, I'm hoping that the Court could, once notice is given, issue the subpoena so we can get it served. The documents are returnable to your Honor, not the parties. And then we're not holding up production by the briefing.
20
21 THE COURT: I agree with that.
22
23 MS. COMEY: Understood, your Honor.
24
25 THE COURT: So I will issue the subpoena with the

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300

DOJ-OGR-00008257
